fieldDescription: If system folds shield deploy it after system ends if it was deployed when you activated the system
Press RMB while overloaded/venting to deploy shield/activate phase cloak right after overload/venting ends
Settings for shield auto targetting, controls shield for you

0 - No snapping
1 - Snaps to ship's target follow mouse if no target
2 - Snaps to current target and stay snap to it even if target changes
3 - Snaps to current position relative to the ship
4 - Snaps to current position relative to the world
Saves selected mode between combat ecnounters
Snaps to ship's target follow mouse if no target
Snaps to current target and stay snap to it even if target changes
Snaps to current position relative to the ship
Snaps to current position relative to the world
Color is in RGBA, set alpha (last number) to 0 to NOT ovverride
Color is in RGBA, set alpha (last number) to 0 to NOT ovverride
Shows system notify on player ship
Real time clock in compaign in left top corner under game date
12 hours AM/PM style clock
Do not disable Sustained Burn when using Active Sensor Burst. Fleet will move slowly for the cool-down duration (instead of doing full stop)
Automatically provide partial survey for planets within your sensor range.
Use Scavenge ability as soon as it is usable. There is a new ability (with blue scavenge icon) that is used to turn this functionality on
Automatically turn off fleet transponder whenever transitioning to Hyperspace

Enables Version Checker if set to true. Change is only applied when the game is [restarted]. 

This only disables Lunalibs version checker, not ones added by other mods like Nexerelin.
Controls how many entries can show up in the Debug Menu's Search Screens. Higher quantities will lead to lag.
Changes the keybind for the devmode toggle.
When pressed in the campaign, opens a debug panel showcasing different UI elements added by Lunalib. Only useful for mod developers.

defaultValue:
Any value below is merely an example for Modders. 
None of the Settings here do anything.

fieldDescription: Strings will accept any characters put in, with no filtering.
A button that switches between true and false.
Int Fields will only accept whole Numbers, and block any other character from being entered.
Doubles allow only numbers and a single decimal dot (.)

Lets users register a keybind. The saved keycodes are the same as used by org.lwjgl.input.Keyboard and Starsectors InputEventAPI.

Make sure to set a condition for your input checks to not accept numbers of 0, as lwjgl sets both unbound & unknown characters to that value.
Creates a color picker, giving both a hex text field and three sliders for the HSV color selection.

secondaryValue: None, Hegemony, Tritachyon, Persean League, Sindrian, Independent
fieldDescription:
Creates a radio button selector. 

The defaultValue decides which one is selected by default, the secondaryValue creates the list of choices with a comma seperated String. 
Can be retrieved as a String.
